page.title: 09Hollinwood Market
page.content: At the market there are 40 stalls in the open and 2 that are not occupied. All the stalls are made from wood and they are open only on Thursdays. The perimeter of the market is 124m. Most of the stalls sell cards, clothes and books but there are also stalls selling fruit, sweets and other food. One of the stalls was full of different kinds of fish from Fleetwood. There were more women on the market than men. The only men there were quite old apart from the stall holders who were younger. Most people shopped every week. Some people went shopping most weeks but some usually went shopping in Oldham Town Centre. Most of the people did most of their shopping in Oldham and bought clothes at Hollinwood market.
